subject: Re: Etch on a Thinkpad T23
body:
On Sat, May 5, 2007 03:59, Jonathan Yavner wrote:
>> Suggestion: add that website to the list on
[...]
> I bought my 600E from http://LinuxCertified.com  It worked out of the
> box!  But their T22-with-Ubuntu is twice the price of the T23 I bought
> sans OS.  Is it really worth $200 to have somebody else install/tune
> Linux for you?  What if I just sold a DVD without the hardware?

Well, I for one would be interested if I had a T22.  I have 600E that runs
etch flawlessly except for the sound system and modem (which never work
under linux on any laptop in my experience) and some issues with the
PCMCIA and USB ports.  But if someone had a DVD that would solve any or
all of  those problems, I would be very keen:  I simply cannot afford a
couple of days per issue, which is what it usually takes even with a good
ADSL connection.

richard



-- 
To UNSUBSCRIBE, email to debian-laptop-REQUEST@lists.debian.org
with a subject of "unsubscribe". Trouble? Contact listmaster@lists.debian.org
